The spacious and elegant house belonging 70

now open and handsomely furnished tor we re-

perntendence of the Subscriber.


This WATERING PLACE is hnely sltnated III
the high and healthy country, five miles west OF
Wilmington, commanding an extensive view y,
the surrounding country, the River delaware ana
the ncighboring States. The grounds OF the
company afford pleasant and shady promehades'
and are bounded by fine streams


The virtues OF the Waters arc those oi the pur-
est Chalybeate, according to the analysis or rro-
fcssor Kea,ing, of Philadelphia. They have been
particularly eiiicaciols III biiiohs anu olhet le'
yers. and are celebrated as fine tonic


The vicinity to Wilmington, offers at all times
access to an excellent market; and the daily m
tercourse by steam Boat lines between thai
place and New Castle, to and from fhladelpila
and Baltimore, affords facility OF comm'ihica
ton not possessed by any other Watering Pace
Parties can be accommodated at j short notice
with dinners, coll,tions, Ice creams, NC. sc


No exertons shall be spared by the Proprietor
to CRAFTY every want the visitor to tins pleas
ant and salubrous Retreat


Charges will be moderate


CHARLES STANLEY.

ssAfind your Business. This is an excellent
e,xhortation, which in days of yore, we used to
zee stamped upon some of the old fashioned
Bhode Island coin--"Mnd yoar Business. =
There was more real vaiie to our fathers IN these
three words, than there was in the coppers on
which they stood imprinted,--more value, be-
cause they not only admonish the holder to SO to
work honestly to obtain more Of them, but they
were calculated 10 promote his health as they m
creased his industry, and TO make him respecta-
Bile as they kent him out of other peoples bust
ness Reader! let these words, as the saying IS,
stare YOU full in the face,' whenever you sally
out into the idler's list, or whenever you are on
the point of nquiring into the concerns or med
ding with the business of others in which You
have no interest, and, our word for IT, Yourself
will be the gamer. aMd. e@fon'

ing lands Of +. H. Hotzbccker, the heirs OF Mil-
liam Lindsey, dec, Zachariah Jones, and Others
containing 106 acres, "more or less. his Farm
is on a black oak and hickory soil, in hish state
of cultivation, and equaled by few in the neigh
bourhood,-t is well adapted to all KINDS of
Grasses and Grain.--ha on il q Young thriving
orchard of about one hundred trees OF choice
fruit; an excellent bottom meadow, through
which runs a never failing stream; and seven u
lagos or fields, all under good fence. The m
pruvements are atwo story log dwelling house,
well weather-boarded outside and lathcd ana
psstered inside, having three rooms down and
four up stairs, with a first rate cellar under the
whole. Also, kitchen adjoining, with pump
of excellent water at the door; stone mix
house and a smoke hoase; frame barn, nearly
new, with excellent stabling underneath, SUM
cient to hold ten or twelve head OF horses, be
sides mich cows, calves, &C. Further dcsclp,

iy engraved title-page.


Price of subscription 81 50 per annum, paya-
Bile in advance. Postmasters and others out OF
the CITY, procuring FIVE subscribers and becon,-
ing responsible for the payment, VIII be entitled

own share of the arrangements, the publishc
binds himself, in case he should fail to perform

"Ilaving been requested TO state, what experl-

part, and his general healti Was much impaired


lie has taken nearly two bottles, and his parent


say he has been more free Of pain than before


while his general health is fast improving.


The third is a Lady, whose disease is suppose,


to be Rhonmatc-and who has long s,lficrc,

was origlnally-ls much less swollen, very slight
: ly paintul--and she say she has received nor
